name: Kartoffelsuppe nach Bayrischer Art (Bavarian Potato Soup)
author: Marianne
summary: Packed with vegetables and sausages, this classic Bavarian-style potato soup is more of a main dish than a starter. In Germany the sausage of choice would be Regensburg sausage, a short and stubby parboiled pork sausage. It can be substituted with other boiling sausages made of pork.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, or to taste
1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or to taste
1 pinch dried marjoram, or to taste
1 pinch sweet paprika, or to taste
1 pinch ground nutmeg, or to taste
directions: Place sausages in a small pot and cover with water; bring to a boil
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until no longer pink in the center, 10 to 15 minutes
Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat
Cook potatoes in the hot oil, stirring often, until they start to crisp on the edges, about 8 minutes
Stir in carrots, onions, leek, scallions, and garlic
Dissolve vegetable bouillon in hot water; pour into the pot
Season soup with salt, black pepper, marjoram, paprika, and nutmeg
Bring to a boil; reduce the heat and cook, covered, until carrots are tender, about 30 minutes
Stir sausage slices, parsley, and chives into the soup
Simmer until flavors combine, about 5 minutes
Stir in sour cream just before serving
